review_text:
Place was fairly clean and cute. Loved being able to bring my dog, walk around the property, and still felt very secluded despite having to drive past main home to get to "apartment" which is more like a barndominium. Bed was so comfortable we're buying the same mattress to replace ours.
The place wasn't pristine (dirty microwave, a few ants in the bathroom but we stayed the first nice weekend of spring so that was not a shocker) but overall clean and comfortable. If you're sensitive to smells, you can tell pets have stayed there but overall wasn't bad, we got used to it.
For price, this place was a good value, great location near hiking trails and the wine trail, and would definitely stay again.

review_text: We had a very lovely stay at Brenda's place. The kitchen was very well furnished, and the huge bed very comfortable. The outdoor patio is right next to the studio and a perfect place from which to enjoy the stunning surroundings. The wide windows in the living room and the bedroom also allow to enjoy the peaceful landscape and the pond/lake from inside. The property is vast and we only walked down to the pond/lake but there is much more to explore. Another positive aspect: it is a short drive from beautiful trails in the Shawnee Forest. The bathroom is indeed small but with a nice shower. Easy to work on the kitchen counter or to enjoy a movie from the couch. It was a perfect pick for us and a very good price for what the place offers.

review_text: This is a great little place especially for 2 people. The bed is big and comfortable and the whole place was very clean. Full kitchen with all the necessities. As it is described in the listing, the bathroom is tiny but the hot water is hot and the water pressure is good so it was perfect for everything we needed a bathroom for. I especially enjoyed sitting at the outdoor "gazebo" area drinking my coffee in the morning or a beer in the evening and listening to the bullfrog serenade coming from the pond. Very quiet and peaceful location. Easy check in and entry. I understand some people have had trouble finding this place when they first arrive, but before we arrived I looked up the address on (rhymes with) Oogle Street View which showed the mailbox across the street. I just flipped Street View 180Â° and it showed me the driveway from the street so I knew exactly what I was looking for and had no problem at all. We will definitely look to stay here again.

review_text: Brenda was extremely responsive. I stayed at her place twice for approximately a week each time. Both times minor things happened (i.e. lights went out in bathroom, flipped a breaker, etc.). She not only responded quickly, but had the things fixed in record time. I was on a third shift schedule, so peace and quiet was important. I never had a problem falling/staying asleep. The wifi is good for streaming videos and doing online work. The location is in close proximity to restaurants and shopping. The apartment was over all clean (dusted, wiped down, linens washed, etc.), but is due for a deep clean. Had I only been staying for a few days I don't think I would have noticed anything, but being there a week you start to notice dust build up in the areas that don't typically get cleaned on a weekly basis in any home. I 100% recommend Brenda's place. I cannot put enough emphasis on the kindness and response time of the hosts!

Wonderful! I have stayed in many Airbnbâ€™s, and Iâ€™ve never had a bad experience. But this is the ONLY one Iâ€™ve loved so much that I had to return for a second visit. The living space is comfortable and cozy, with many small touches that show what a thoughtful host Brenda is! The kitchen has all you need to prepare any meal, and Iâ€™m impressed by the great quality of all the cooking utensils, pans, appliances, etc.
The king bed and pull out couch are really comfortable. The friend who came with me loved the bed mattress so much that she ordered one for herself when she got home!
The outdoor covered patio overlooking the pond is just lovely, and I spent much of my time out there watching deer, great blue herons, and all the wildlife a pond attracts. And the view for star gazing is amazing!
Although itâ€™s only minutes from Carbondale, youâ€™d never know it in this quiet setting. Also, itâ€™s only minutes from Giant City State Park, and many other beautiful hiking and fishing spots.
Brenda is a great host, answering messages quickly and taking care of any need I had.
I canâ€™t recommend this place highly enough. I WILL be back for the third time as soon as I can!

review_text: My family and I really enjoyed this cozy little place during our one week stay. The apartment is clean and everything is labeled so you do not need to guess where things might be. name: Denise
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
Â·
June 2022
,
Â·
Stayed a few nights
review_text:
HIGHLY RECOMMEND!
We enjoyed our stay here SO much. Inside, the kitchen was well stocked with quality cookware, utensils, and appliances. All the shelves and cabinets were labeled with their contents, which made finding things so much easier. The bathroom is small but clean. The king bed is very comfortable. (We didnâ€™t use the pull out couch bed.) Lots of closet room and dressers for our stuff. Many small, tasteful touches throughout the apartment.
Being a nature lover, I particularly enjoyed the outdoor areas. The patio overlooking the pond is lovely, comfortable seating surrounded by well tended flowers and shrubs. Two bird feeders hang near the house, and I enjoyed watching all the activity there, as well as the herons and turkeys at the pond. The grounds are so well maintained, making it easy to stroll the entire property. We are hikers, and we were only about 10 minutes away from the trails at Giant City S.P., which was perfect. But, we were also only minutes away from shops and restaurants in Carbondale. The best of both worlds!
Brenda and her husband were gracious and helpful, and I look forward to staying here again!

review_text:
Hello Travelers! This is a cute, minimalist and cozy space. This is perfect for those looking to explore Carbondale city from a quieter perspective, for those looking to spend time exploring Giant City, and a beautiful beginning for a drive out to explore Garden of the Gods. The property is beautiful with full views of the pond, land, and a cute outdoor sitting area. Belle, the pooch, is super friendly and will come visit you when she does her rounds. At night around dusk, watch out the windows next to the bedroom door! We saw so many deer running around at dusk. it was perfect. You can bring a telescope! the views are great.
This would be a great location for those wanting to make it to any fests Makanda and Carbondale are hosting. Don't forget to take a break from cooking and check out the Long Branch Cafe in Carbondale (and you may find some treasures if your vintage clothing hunting at Vintage Tropicana, just past Long Branch's parking lot - you can't miss it! there are traffic signs indicating when they're open - just call them about their shop).
Enjoy Boskydell road!

Dericks treehouse was absolutely amazing! The inside of the treehouse was immaculately done. We loved the decor. It was modern with a rustic feel. We felt at home as soon as we entered the treehouse. It was a little hard to find because we arrived at night and it was DARK! Itâ€™s not exactly where the pin shows on maps, but about 1/4 mile away. No big deal, after a little driving we found it no problem. We love how much there was to do so close by! We enjoyed hiking the panthers den loop, checking out the wineries with live music, and finally the best brunch Iâ€™ve had in a loooong time at Fork and Vine. We visited the cute boardwalk of Makanda for ice cream and even checked out the Goreville food market. The little towns were like stepping back in time.
We spent most of the time enjoying the beautiful weather on the wrap around porch. It was such a nice getaway from the city. We truly enjoyed every moment!

review_text: The treehouse was everything we wanted and more for our first mother-son adventure! My 7 year old and I wanted to get away from the city and do some hiking in the area. We were also looking for a place that would be away from other people, peaceful, and adventurous while still providing enough home-like comforts for a somewhat picky child. The treehouse was all of that and more. We were especially thankful for the firepit and s'mores as they helped us create memories. The hot/cold water dispenser with filtered water was definitely a bonus for us as we filled our hiking packs every time we left for a hike. I loved the added touch of freshly roasted coffee. (It went well with my French press I brought!) Sitting on the porch in the early morning with fresh coffee and a book while the hummingbirds buzzed around me was a type of peace I won't soon forget! I think the treehouse would make the perfect getaway for anyone looking for peace and a bit of adventure.

If you are looking for a place to unplug and retreat into nature, this is it! Quiet, peaceful, and pet friendly! We loved sitting outside and listening to the forest, there were a ton of hummingbirds hanging out around the house that were so much fun to watch. The house itself is clean, well kept, and well stocked.
One thing you should be aware of: no wifi, no cable, and we barely had cell phone signal (had to stand in certain places in the house/outside to send a text, DEFINITELY no internet surfing!) Not a problem for us, it was really nice to be away from everything. Just know what youâ€™re signing up for and plan accordingly.
Derick was very informative, friendly, and offered good information about local places and happenings.
My husband and I highly recommend staying here, and I am sure we will be returning to the tree house again!

review_text:
Derick's place was the perfect spot for our Shawnee National Forest adventure.
After looking through many listings, we decided that its secluded location in the forest would be a perfect spot for a getaway. With the beautiful wildlife, the courtesy s'mores kit and the kitschy movie collection, we barely touched our phones. And we found that just driving a mile or so down the road was good enough to get the cell service we needed to make a few quick calls to family back home.
At the cabin, we were able to cook great meals, rest after long days of hiking, and most of all enjoy the scenery from the porch and even the 2nd story outlook. (Our favorite part was waking up to the hummingbirds buzzing at the feeder right outside our windows.)
We also enjoyed going to Feather Hills Vineyard and the Blue Sky Vineyard. They were both close to the cabin. Both great spots for wine tastings... and for being around some friendly vacationers and their dogs too.

Second, I have to say how beautifully and thoughtfully this place is put together, down to the smallest of details. Every time we realized that we'd forgotten something, or wished we'd brought, we could just open a drawer or cabinet and there it was!
I mean literally anything you could think of.
Host left us freshly roasted (delicious) coffee and didn't hesitate, when we ran out needed more to hook us up.
It was such a special time for us, to just BE without distraction.
My husband has ordaned that the Tree House is officially our NEW Anniversary destination, (you've been warned Derrick, we're coming back!)
A perfect little place....
Thank you Derrick, you're awesome!

The Tree House was a great place to relax and unwind. As described it was nestled in the woods set along a slope. Although near a local road, there was extremely little traffic (i.e., maybe a car or two an hour). The vast majority of sounds we heard was from the local bird population.
The Tree House had the basic necessities for a comfortable stay. Derrick even provided a smores package for those wanting to take advantage of the fire pit. The Tree House had all kinds of little quirky details demonstrating the thoughtfulness put into making the space welcoming and inviting. It was a fun place to stay.
The Tree House was a great launch location to see parts of southern Illinois, which has a lot to offer. We did some of trails and had a breakfast at the Giant City State Park near by. We also checked out some of Cache River wetlands areas in addition to the Pomona Natural Bridge in the Shawnee National Forest. Lots of adventures available in the area.

review_text:
Derick's description of the property was spot-on, and the location was perfect for us. Derick's recommendations (on the website) were informative and helpful. (Unfortunately, the E-Town Fish Restaurant had floated 100 ft into the Ohio River, so that's currently a no-go!)
Many wonderful hiking destinations within an hour's drive (Panther's Den trailhead is less than a mile up the road, Ferne Clyffe 15 minute drive, and many others).
Two wineries within a few miles of the house, and others nearby.
Derick owns the forest land behind the house, so you can get in some fun hiking right out the door. Very quiet and peaceful.
The house is compact, but well thought out, and fit our needs nicely.
The furniture, kitchen equipment, etc. were in excellent shape; everything was very clean and functional. The surrounding outdoor deck was wonderful. Small pets and mobility-compromised people may have trouble negotiating the spiral staircase, so check with Derick before booking if you're concerned.

review_text:
Feel free to read the other reviews, as I share our Homestead Cottage holiday (Thanksgiving '23) experience. Chris accommodated our evening arrival with the porch light assisting our check-in. Our timing & the rural setting, especially in light of the shotgun hunting season, offered plenty of nature sightings. Chris' thoughtfulness includes a flashlight to offset insects' instinctual lure of a porch light. The self check-in was a much welcomed blessing.
This all electric Cottage (no CO source) employs a tankless hot water heater, which is simple with little adjustment from common tanks. It's cozy & energy efficient in spite of the fall-winter temperatures. The range & stove are apartment sized (24"), so no Cottage baking (a good thing from my perspective). Chris' Homestead Cottage truly made our first Holiday rental simple and affordable - please pass along our thanks to your support crew, Chris.

There's another heater/AC in the main living area that worked perfectly as well. We enjoyed looking at and petting the horses and goats...they were all friendly and curious and just adorable. I would chat with Chris before doing anything on your own bc the fences can be live and she will tell you about each horses personality, etc.
The area is very close to the downtown on Carbondale, which had some great dining spots. Our kids LOVED the Boo Park too!

,
Â·
Stayed with a pet
review_text: This cabin was an oasis for us. Deep in the woods but completely accessible, surrounded by tall trees and wildflowers with a valley behind us. We saw so many deer and at night too many stars to count (also witness the rare northern lights event in southern Illinois!). Waking up and sitting on the rocking chairs, drinking coffee and watching the sunrise was the most peaceful. The cabin itself was immaculate, almost as if everything was brand new! The bed was beyond dreamy and comfortable, even the pull out sleep sofa was comfy - we all slept very soundly. The kitchen had everything we needed, and we did cook large meals. The hot tub is better than most with the jets actually powerful enough to feel like a light massage. The bathroom was spotless and having access to a washer dryer was neat, after the hot tub we would dry off our suits before the next dip. We definitely will be back, it was a much needed retreat from graduation madness. Thank you so much!

Perfect. This cabin was perfect for my recent long-weekend solo getaway. The listing is accurate. No unpleasant surprises. The property is very easy to find. Adequate parking. Immaculate and very tasteful interior. Amenities are awesome, practically brand new throughout. The hot tub is easy to cover and uncover and very nice to relax in with different color lights. The â€œfireplaceâ€ not only looks cool but also puts out good heat on a cool evening. The fire pit is great to sit at. There is plenty of fire wood and the chairs are very comfy to relax in. Bathroom and bedroom are very tasteful and highly functional. 4-5 miles from Giant City state park. 5-6 miles from Kroger in Carbondale. 30 minutes from Marion. 1 hour to Cape Girardeau, MO makes these an supremely well located cabin. Access into the area is easy and is partially paved and gravel. Entry in the home was simple. WiFi worked well.
I loved everything about this cabin. I hope I can stay here again.

name: Christina
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
Â·
July 2023
,
Â·
Stayed with kids
review_text:
Samantha's place had lots of comforts of home, was stocked with the essentials plus more. Which made for a comfortable week long stay to visit with our kid who lives nearby.
The 3rd bedroom is in the attic floor, which did get hot during those 100 degree days even with the A/C on.
If you are a light sleeper, bring ear plugs, sleep mask and maybe dont share a bed. The train is nearby and can be well heard and like other older raised wood foundation homes sound travels. The wood slat blinds, which match the decor well do let light in from both the exterior solar lights as well as the early morning sun. And the mattresses are very springy so the slightest movement bounces the whole bed which meant I kicked my husband out of the bed.
The parking was an issue at timea because people in the basement rental kept parking in the driveway as well. And someone in the basement unit was smoking weed which hot boxed the kitchen in as all that seperates the 2 rentals is a basement door.

name: Lynn
rating_info:
Rating, 3 stars
,
Â·
November 2022
,
Â·
Stayed with a pet
review_text:
Positives: Affordable, pet friendly, access to washer and dryer, responsive hosts.
Negatives: Limited parking, poor lighting, train noise.
We booked this place the day of travel and let the owners know we would be a late check in. We arrived after dark. Another guest who had booked the basement level had already claimed the driveway, which was too narrow for more than one vehicle. We had to park our large truck with a lot of our belongings in it across the narrow street. The lighting outside the front door is inadequate to see the entry clearly in the dark. After fumbling with the lock box, we texted the host, who informed us the key code is for the door lock. The hosts were responsive and polite. However, I would not stay here again, mainly because there were trains nearby coming through all hours of the night and into the morning with their whistles blowing loudly. I would recommend this place to groups of 1-4 people who can arrive in daylight and are used to train noise.

Towels and washcloths are thick and plush. There are robes, slippers and beach towels in the wardrobe. The pool, soaking tub and sauna are fantastic and you have privacy to enjoy them. Explore the gardens and pick your favorite herbs and veggies. There are instructions for everything and suggestions for restaurants and activities in the area. The icing on the cake was the tray left on the table with delicious cheese, olives, nuts, honey and olive oil with salt and spices. I have a gluten allergy and Jane provided a GF baguette and homemade GF pumpkin craisin loaf. So yummy!!! Only regret was that I was only there for a long weekend. Definitely going back for a longer stay.

Welcoming. Thoughtful. Comfortable.
If you're wondering if you should stay here, do. It is the most relaxing and rejuvenating place I've been since this whole pandemic started. The hosts are attentive without being intrusive, and their lovely touches are everywhere - from a little holiday bouquet of holly to a towel warmer in the bathroom to excellent books. It has the most comfortable bed I've ever stayed in at an airbnb and a beautiful garden that's a bird and butterfly sanctuary. The outdoor tub and sauna were wonderful - it's like being at your own private spa. I loved sitting in the tub and watching the birds at the feeder. They're about 10-15 minutes away from some great hiking trails. Oh, and if you like to cook while you're away, this is the place! A fully stocked spice rack *and* vacation necessities like hot chocolate and popcorn in the cupboards :) Strongly recommended.

name: Tyler

Rating, 5 stars

,
Â·
Stayed a few nights
review_text:
First and foremost, the hype throughout these many, many positive reviews is 100% warranted and deserved. This experience, curated by the hospitality pros D. and Jane, was above and beyond what I expected from Airbnb's realm of possibilities.
My partner Kerry and I spent a few days at the Pool House as a retreat away from our day to day in alcohol sales. COVID-19 has made the busy nature of that world much more stress inducing and exhausting, but our several (seriously, several) trips into the hot tub and sauna left us both feeling immensely refreshed. The Pool House is the perfect oasis that will leave you with a clear mind.
The amenities are endless. The sheer attention to detail is amazing. I don't expect to find another Airbnb that comes close in comparison. Our trip was during bleak winter weather conditions, but that didn't make it any less of an enjoyable trip. We're looking forward to returning during warmer months, too, though. Buyer beware, book this immediately! Also, go ahead and add another day or two to your planned trip here; we sure wish we did.

The space was perfectly clean, so cute and stylish, and the extra touches of the homemade breads and snacks they provided made the trip even more pleasant. I brought my two dogs along with me, and it was so helpful that they were able to provide crates for me to use so I didn't have to lug those with me.
Overall, I would recommend this airbnb to anyone looking for a relaxing getaway with wonderful hosts.

Our hosts, D. and Jane, were the ultimate superhosts for our 3-day stay at their Pool House. Their genuine warmth and care made us feel pampered and appreciated, and we would welcome them if they come to our city. Beyond their hospitality, we found check-in to be easy. There were several aesthetically pleasing note cards placed throughout the house that made navigating all the homeâ€™s features very fun and logical. Care for detail and comfort are the best features of our stay. Janeâ€™s fresh garden herbs, conveniently left for us, enabled us to indulge in gourmet delights that made us feel at home. Her jam, baked goods, and snacks and beverages spoiled us. The king-size bedâ€”with a variety of pillow optionsâ€”was exquisitely comfortable, especially after a soaking in the authentic Japanese Ofuro Tub-For-Two and Finnish sauna. It made for peaceful, sweet sleep. In addition, the towel warmer, fully stocked kitchen, and retro â€œDanish Modernâ€ wood dÃ©cor made for the perfect getaway. In fact, we stayed an extra day! Jane was very helpful to guide us to local shops and hiking trails, and D. went out of his way to help us be happy as well. This property has a fascinating history, and our hosts are stewards
of their town. We look forward to returning with our family one day.

review_text: What a gem--far and away our best AirBnB experience! Hosts D. and Jane are outstanding hosts and even better human beings. They are my favorite kind of people: those who leave this world a better place than the one they found. The Pool House is a lovingly curated home. We loved their taste in furnishings and dÃ©cor, which are eclectic and lean pleasantly heavy on a sophisticated mid-century modern aesthetic. We were delighted to find not only all the creature comforts of home, but lovely and thoughtful touches such as a gift of home-made and delicious pumpkin bread, and fresh herbs displayed on our tableâ€”in November!â€”to add to our cooking. All the comforts of home are here, and there are features that you would be more used to seeing in a four-star hotel than at an AirBnB rentalâ€”plush white robes for the soaking tub! We came to hike the nearby Shawnee National Forest. What a treat to come home to that Japanese soaking tub and a sauna and pool. The property and garden are huge, and a certified Audubon society butterfly and bird sanctuary. We will return here in a heartbeat. We are so grateful to Jane and D for helping us rescue Thanksgiving from COVID and this horrible year.

Such a beautiful and unique space. Walking distance to the university and many places to eat, grocery shop, etc. The unit itself was perfect for our needs. We were traveling to visit friend and family and it was a great home base for two adults and two teen boys. The boys commented a few times on how cool the place was and thanked us for booking it, which if you know teens, never happens! Great touches like snacks (some homemade!), drinks, bathroom toiletries and a table set with bright, cheery dishes. The airbed was very easy to set up and very comfortable (the pickiest of the 4 slept there and he thought it was just fine!) We heard right away with details after booking and check in was a breeze with the code for the door. A designated parking space was a real added bonus.
Since one of us was originally from Carbondale, we didn't need local advice, but there was plenty of literature and a listing of their own recommendations so that would definitely have been covered had we needed it. We briefly met Jane and D. and they were lovely as well. Since we're in Carbondale often, we are already looking forward to staying there again!
Check out was again easy with the code and the provided list of where to put everything once we were done with it. I've stayed in a lot of airbnbs and this was my favorite so far!

The kitchen is very well equipped and when we arrived there were several drinks in the fridge, snacks on the counter, coffee packets for us as well as Janeâ€™s homemade pumpkin bread and some local apples. The bedroom is very comfortable. Every last detail was thought of such as an adhesive lint roller and essential oil diffuser in the bedroom, heated towel rack in the bathroom. The hosts are very friendly and knowledgeable about the area, it was fun to get to chat with them a bit. My favorite time was enjoying coffee on the porch in the morning, sitting near the wren house and listening to the lovely birdcalls. We hope to visit again!

review_text: This review is for the basement apartment. I was on my own. This place is a very clean, well organized space. Little natural light, but it's a basement. Comfortable bed, decent neighborhood, adequate street parking (which was a bit hampered by the number of driveways and it was garbage collection night). Check In was easy. A minor problem with the door lock was quickly resolved. Host communication and response time were very prompt. Other guests in the apartment above noisy at times but nothing interfered with comfort or sleep. Location was pretty good. Carbondale isn't a big town so getting anywhere is easy. Close to the east-west highway so access to Murphysboro and all that good barbecue was nice too. I'd choose this again for value, cleanliness, ease of access and host communications.

review_text: We stayed at this air bnb for one night on the way to Tennessee and then on our way back from Tennessee. Our first stay here was a five star rating. Everything was clean, tidy and smelled fresh. It was exactly as expected. On our way back, it was clear that someone had been smoking weed (debris in a blanket and paper towels to block the smell from moving to other parts of the house)- the space was otherwise clean. I contacted the host right away and she got back to me on where to find some more clean linens, and apologized for the oversight of the cleaning crew (im guessing it may have been a quick turn around from the last person leaving and is arriving). She also made things right financially. While our 2nd trip wasn't ideal, the host was professional and quick to help problem solve. We return to this area often and would stay again! Overall a very nice place to stay with a host that communicates well.

We felt at home and comfortable in the space. We highly recommend this space for future Carbondale/SIU visitors. The host is very responsive and offers good feedback.

,
Â·
Stayed one night
review_text: Samanthas place was a good resting spot for our cross country trip. A couple of things that weren't mentioned were that this is the bottom unit and the top unit is also rented by airbnb guests. They had some loud "adult time" and the ceiling is extremely thin so unfortunately we had to leave as we were trying to settle in. Which is no fault to the owner, I just wasn't under the impression it was rented by other airbnb guests from the listing description. Next, the room was pretty warm even with the screen and window open and there was no fan so we ended up having to purchase one. Third, the other tenants parked in the driveway so we had to park on the very narrow street and us being in a large truck it was unsettling. Other than these things, the room was very clean and tastefully decorated with amazing amenities.
